intro: Oxytropis neorechingeriana, commonly known as the Neorechinger's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is adapted to thrive in poor soils and can tolerate drought conditions. Oxytropis neorechingeriana is often found in steppe and desert environments, contributing to local biodiversity.
